jobDescription: Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all. Join an inclusive team passionate about one thing: using their expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we build help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can fuel the very innovation we are pursuing. Description As a People Solutions Analyst – Workday you will primarily be responsible for maintaining and ensuring effective management of Workday modules such as Core HCM and Talent and Performance. You will work with HR program owners to understand requirements and then research system capabilities. Day-to-day work would include configuration, testing, and implementation of changes and enhancements, troubleshooting administrative and user technical issues, and assisting with documentation of how-to and best-known methods. Additionally, you will ensure data accuracy for the business to report on compliance and initiatives. Essential Functions Responsible for planning, designing, and testing Workday system configurations. Develop proposed configuration solutions, addressing business issues and objectives using a combination of the company standardized and Workday Methodologies. Support system maintenance, troubleshoot issues, and aid level 1 and level 2 support within required SLAs. Provide guidance on how to leverage the system to drive efficiency and optimize system functionality. Perform routine audits on data to ensure data quality. Leverage data to better understand end user needs, drive system utilization, and to constantly improve user experience. Work with a variety of third-party providers and vendors to ensure data is flowing correctly between systems. Act as liaison for integration questions and assist technical integration analyst with testing, communication, and overall integration status. Work closely with Workday product owners to influence and provide inputs into roadmap. Make recommendations for future improvements to workflow processes and user experience. Position Qualifications Analytical Skills - Ability to use thinking and reasoning to solve a problem. Able to communicate with customers and colleagues with impact, credibility, and influence. Excellent customer focus, able to assess customer needs, build relationships and manage customer expectations. Decision Making - Ability to make critical decisions while following company procedures. Interpersonal - Ability to get along well with a variety of personalities and individuals. Problem Solving - Ability to find a solution for or to deal proactively with work-related problems. Ability to support initiatives across global teams. Education & Experience Bachelor’s degree required At least 2+ years Workday System Administration Reporting and analysis experience desired/recommended, strong Excel skills Must be comfortable working as part of a team or independently to meet goals About Micron Technology, Inc. With a relentless focus on our customers, technology leadership, and manufacturing and operational excellence, Micron delivers a rich portfolio of high-performance DRAM, NAND, and NOR memory and storage products through our Micron® and Crucial® brands. Every day, the innovations that our people create fuel the data economy, enabling advances in artificial intelligence and 5G applications that unleash opportunities — from the data center to the intelligent edge and across the client and mobile user experience. As a Fab Equipment Technician Apprentice at Micron Technology in Boise, Idaho, you will learn how to monitor, sustain, and improve the equipment and processes in our world-class Technology Development Fab. Micron apprenticeships offer an “earn while you learn” model that is flexible based on current school schedule. You will work in partnership with production team members and area Technicians and Engineers and assist in monitoring tool performance, scheduling and perform preventative maintenance on assigned tool sets. You will use mechanical, electronic and PC/software skills to troubleshoot and repair equipment issues. Equipment could include Diffusion/Implant, PCVD, Wet Chemical Process, Dry Etch/Plasma, CMP, Photolithography, and Fab Support. Responsibilities Complete the required safety training and conduct all work in accordance with safety policies Performs and facilitates audits and submits good catches (safe-catch program) on safety issues Partners with Production and Shift Engineers/Technicians to execute daily priorities Accurately documents the work performed and current tool statuses Provides troubleshooting support for equipment-related problems and addresses root causes Improves tool availability by finding solutions to ongoing problems Qualifications High School Diploma and 1 year of AAS in Electronics, Mechatronics, Robotics, or equivalent technical degree. Basic knowledge of AC/DC circuits, including fundamentals of electricity Basic PC skills including MS Office Word, Excel and PowerPoint Solid time management and prioritization skills Ability to multi-tasking and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment Enjoy working in a team environment Good verbal and written communication skills Must be flexible to work any shift and rotate shifts as needed (taking in to account current school schedule) About Micron Technology, Inc. As a Fab Manufacturing Technician (MT) Apprentice at Micron Technology in Boise, Idaho, you will learn how to sustain and improve cycle time by facilitating product movement in our world-class Technology Development Fab. Micron apprenticeships offer a “earn while you learn” model that is flexible based on current school schedule. You will work in partnership with production & engineering team members by keeping lot mean time at step (MTAS) low and supporting engineering tasks. Manufacturing Technician Apprentices assist in monitoring tool performance, scheduling product and you are the first responder on area inefficiencies, i.e. lots not tracking/staging, data not downloading, tool lockups, and lot processed verification. The MT utilizes production planning reports to review historical workstation performance and identify areas for improvement.   Responsibilities Completes all required safety training and conducts all work in accordance with safety policies Partners with other area MTs and engineering teams to execute daily priorities. Micron is looking for a Chemical System Engineer to join our team. In this role, you will lead the design and optimization of chemical distribution systems at the Boise, Idaho campus. You will be performing your job in collaboration with other talented subject matter experts to achieve team success as a facilities organization. Driving safety, sustainability, reliability, efficiency, and cost effectiveness will be your pillars for excelling in this role. Collaboration with production engineers and technicians to ensure their needs are being met is a key focus. Partnering with Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM’s) to produce next generation system design improvements is another responsibility and opportunity to make an impact in this role. Micron Technology’s vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life and our dedication to people, innovation, tenacity, collaboration, and customer focus allows us to fulfill our mission to be a global leader in memory and storage solutions. This means conducting business with integrity, accountability, and professionalism while supporting our global community. The team you will be joining is fully engaged in this mission. It's an exciting time to be at Micron and the Boise Facilities Engineering department! Micron has an outstanding opportunity for a high energy, tenacious, ambitious, result driven individual with a strong work ethic and integrity to join our Global Facilities Technology Team in Boise, Idaho. As a Global Facilities Civil, Structural and Architectural Engineer at Micron Technology, Inc., you will be responsible to provide high-quality engineering services and specifications for the planning, design, construction of your subject area specific equipment and buildings components in support of Semiconductor manufacturing across the Micron Global Manufacturing Network. During periods when assigned as an on-site site Subject area Project Engineer your responsibilities will be as follows: You will participate in Project Design and Scope Development, Documentation, and Control Change, Vendor Selection, Project Tendering, and onsite Subject area Project Safety, Coordination and Execution Responsibilities and Tasks Project Team Discipline Lead Coordinate System Design between GFTT, Local Project Team, Vendors, GC etc. Document Subject area Scope Manage Change Process and documentation. Provide Project Procurement Technical Support Ensure all Project scope is performed to Safety Standards and requirements. Review all Job plans for high risk during construction in related areas /scope. Track and Report progress weekly on Project progress, risk, schedule, cost for Subject area Coordinate installation Q&A assurance and Testing and Commissioning Activities. Coordinate and Lead Project Closeout activities for; Punch listing and verification, Documentation and System Handover. During periods when not assigned as on-site site CSA Project Engineer your responsibilities will be as follows: Participate in capacity and scenario planning, specification development and support system troubleshooting and technical issue resolution and evaluate impact of changes. In this role, you will support the Facilities Teams and Manufacturing sites as a domain authority in design, start-up, operations, and maintenance and will ensure environmental, safety, regulatory, and code compliance. Responsibilities and Tasks Design/Construction and Plan Systems and Buildings Provide system designs for safe, reliable, and efficient operations and maintenance Develop, review, and maintain the Micron Global system, equipment, and component Standards and Specifications Ensure material compatibility Ensure designs align with all applicable standards, codes, and regulations Reviewing of the capacity planning databases (with Basebuild capacities, POC assignments, and actual field conditions) across the network and validating utilization and diversity factor assumptions Participate and/or lead capacity and scenario planning including evaluation of system and distribution capacity impacts based on scenario changes Review and advise sites on periodic system status presentations (system capacity, actual load, and projected loads based on all approved scenarios, key system accomplishments, and challenges/issues) Consult on scope, schedule, and cost estimates for Facilities infrastructure additions or modification Provide Project Support Provide Micron Global Standards and Specifications to support the Engineering and Design development for the construction and installation of new facilities infrastructure Provide support for cost and schedule estimates and justification for approval Provide supervision and coordination of Consultant resources required Ensure appropriate communication with local Facilities, Design, Construction, Procurement and Manufacturing partners as required to deliver project objectives and results Perform timely review of design packages and providing detailed comments and feedback Ensure that scope meets requestor needs Ensure change management procedures are followed. Monitor progress and provide support during construction as required per project Provide Technical Support, Leadership, and Expertise Provide consultation and support to Operations and Maintenance and Manufacturing as Technical Subject area Domain Expert Analyze system designs to identify improvements that will result in better performance, efficiency gains, reduced maintenance, and cost savings Provide Technical leadership to Procurement group on vendor qualifications, vendor selection and negotiations as needed. Conduct risk and failure mode and effects analysis Eliminate single points of failure and mitigate risk Benchmark within and external to Micron sites on Engineering and Design Best Known Methods (BKM) of Facilities buildings and systems Develop, own, and maintain Global System Standards, Specifications, and Best Known Method (BKM) standards Maintain equipment support knowledge (reaction modes/mechanisms, hazard protocol, leak detection, etc.) Job Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in Civil, Structural or Architectural Engineering required, Master’s Degree or licensing desired. Minimum 10-year experience in Civil, Structural or Architectural Engineering with a focus on Design and Construction of Semiconductor or similar industrial and manufacturing Facilities. Ability to prioritize and schedule workload and work on multiple tasks concurrently Good organizational skills and Service focus Excellent interpersonal skills and good team working skills, English required Self-motivated worker Familiarity with semiconductor manufacturing and facilities systems Ability to travel internationally up to 50% and within USA 75% of the time Ability to complete onsite assignments within geographical region for 12-18 months About Micron Technology, Inc. Our Opportunity Summary: For more than 43 years, Micron Technology, Inc. has redefined innovation with the world’s most advanced memory and semiconductor technologies. We’re an international team of visionaries and scientists, developing groundbreaking technologies that are transforming how the world uses information to enrich life. This role regards leading all Compute DRAM Design functions at our innovative Design Center in Atlanta, GA which includes product design, verification, and layout responsible for the design & development of Compute DRAM products. You will be responsible for driving the vision, strategy, and execution of the team in support of the global DEG priorities and processes. This position of leadership involves working with a highly innovative and motivated team using groundbreaking memory technologies to develop the most sophisticated Compute DRAM memory products while also collaborating closely with a distributed team of Design Engineering, Product Engineering, Process Development, Package Engineering & Business Units to implement a common goal of ensuring our future Compute DRAM roadmap is successful. Your deep understanding of DRAM and memory subsystem operation to help achieve outstanding performance, power, cost, reliability, and quality for Micron’s Compute DRAM product portfolio will be paramount. Our team vision is a continuing desire to develop your skills working in an inclusive diverse environment of multicultural Teams across worldwide geographies! Enabling the creative career path you deserve with competitive compensation, bonus structure & equity. (Disclaimer): While you may not exhibit all of the characteristics/skills listed below today, we are highly interested in a teammate who is anxious to grow in both technical breadth and depth. Suppose you are open to learning while being a valued member of a team of top-tier engineers. In that case, we are anxious to help build upon your existing foundation, while rapidly growing your individual and collaborative skills in this exciting and outstanding opportunity. What’s Encouraged Daily: Lead a multi-functional engineering team including product design, verification, and layout functions Responsible for the delivery of high-quality, timely work from all multi-functional teams Attract, recruit, train, engage and retain top talent to build a world-class engineering team Challenge the team to set and achieve stretch objectives while focusing on continuous improvement in schedules, quality, and capability Establish a team culture of hard work, innovation, and strong global collaboration with a focus on Micron’s Values Giving cross-group communication to work towards standardization and group success Debug and identify root causes and solutions for pre-silicon and post-silicon issues encountered in current Compute DRAM products and architectures Engage with Customers to support issues with current Compute DRAM architectures and find opportunities to innovate on future solutions Pathfinding to explore new architectures for future Compute DRAM products and make recommendations after performing highly technical feasibility analyses How To Qualify: BSEE or Higher Experience leading highly technical design teams in a multinational design center Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills Familiarity with DRAM operation and JEDEC specifications Extensive experience with CMOS circuit design and a good understanding of semiconductor device physics Knowledge and experience in digital (Verilog) and analog (FastSpice & Hspice) modeling and simulations What Sets You Apart: In-depth technical expertise in one or more areas - DRAM memory array design, high-speed clocking, and interface development, logic and custom circuit design, power delivery optimization, CMOS & semiconductor device physics Good verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively synthesize and convey sophisticated technical concepts to other partners and leadership Strong track record of innovation and problem-solving in high-performance memory development Good understanding of Memory subsystem operation in high-performance computing applications Prior experience with RTL Design flow, in DRAM process or Foundry process Prior experience with package technologies (TSV, hybrid bonding, interposers, etc.) Having an innovative approach that is open to improving upon any process or product. What We Offer at Micron: Total control of how you wish to craft your career path and education. Educational Reimbursement Programs: More information to be provided during the hiring process. What You Will Be Doing In Atlanta, Georgia As a Design Verification Engineer for Micron, you will work with a highly innovative and motivated design and verification team using state of the art memory technologies to develop the most advanced DRAM and Emerging memory products. You will be challenged by the complexity and difficulty of verifying high density memory chips (up to 32Gb) with huge scale of circuit capability (over 4M transistors), ultra-high speed designs, complex functionality which includes next Generation DDR/LPDDR (ex: DDR5, LPDDR5) and advanced low power and power management technologies. You will be responsible to evaluate the functionality and performance of the Full-chip and block-level circuit designs using different verification tools, techniques, and strategies. In addition, you will also need to provide solutions to help deliver a functionally correct design. Lastly, you will need to collaborate closely with Micron's various design, verification, and product engineering teams all over the world to ensure design project success. Your Key Responsibilities Will Include Provide verification support to the DRAM and Emerging Memory Design Engineering teams by simulating, analyzing, and debugging pre-silicon full-chip and block-level designs. Assist product engineering teams with circuit and simulation support during post-silicon validation phase. Develop, run, and maintain verification test benches and vectors using industry standard and inhouse developed programs. Write test patterns/vectors and monitors to enhance the functional coverage for all DRAM and Emerging Memory architectures and features. Automate the collection of simulation data through writing software scripts to improve efficiency. Maintain and enhance inhouse developed verification programs and tools. Collaborate closely with international colleagues to develop new verification methodologies and strategies to take on the future challenges in DRAM and Emerging Memory design. Education & Experience Necessary For Success MS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or equivalent with emphasis on VLSI design and/or Verification. Job title is scalable depending on the candidate's experience/background. Fluent understanding in CMOS circuit design. Familiar with analog simulation methodology and tools, i.e. FINESIM, HSPICE, HSIM. Basic understanding on digital simulators, such as Verilog. Good programming fundamentals with knowledge in Python programming is preferred. Good debugging and problem-solving skills. Must possess good communication skills and ability to work well in a team environment. Work experience in DRAM memory related fields is a plus. About Micron Technology, Inc. As a Technology Reliability Test Engineer, you will be responsible for developing test programs for use in the various facets of the reliability processes. Furthermore, this role entails required modifying, writing, and maintaining stress and characterization (char) code in order to evaluate live die device reliability. In this role you will collaborate with partners in the Design, Product Engineering, Fab, and Global Quality group to evaluate and implement corrective action to the reliability, design, and process issues. Our team vision is a continuing desire to develop your skills working in an inclusive diverse environment of multi-cultural Teams across worldwide geographies! Enabling the creative career path you deserve with competitive compensation, bonus structure & equity. (Disclaimer): While you may not exhibit all of the characteristics/skills listed below today, we are highly interested in a teammate who is anxious to grow in both technical breadth and depth. Suppose you are open to learning while being a valued member of a team of top-tier engineers. In that case, we are anxious to help build upon your existing foundation, while rapidly growing your individual and collaborative skills in this exciting and outstanding opportunity. What’s Encouraged Daily Generate reliability stress code Develop, debug and support stresses test program on concerns highlighted reliability risk Write test programs and support scripts in C++, Python Guarantee through detailed checkout and verification process that stress pattern is producing intended device degradation. Generate characterize circuit degradation Develop char tests to accurately measure device degradation due to stress mechanisms. Generate custom patterns and char to catch targeted defects or failure modes. Analyze reliability failures to determine the electrical signature and potential cause. Provide failure data to the appropriate group (e.g. Process, TD, Design, Fab). Route reliability fails to Electrical Failure Analysis (EFA) and helps drive corrective action. Provide reliability automation support Ensure code will run in the production environment and log char data for reliability analysis. Provide engineering support to reliability production issues to maintain 24x7 operation. Coordinate with Production for hardware capacity. Supervise reliable material as it progresses through stress. Input into design and checkout of the tester hardware used for reliability. Endeavor to improve all aspects of the reliability process Innovate code development to improve efficiency and quality. Improve communication with production to increase efficiency and reduce delays. Write scripts to help analyze data more quickly and efficiently. Participate in new design validation and debugging of software and hardware. How To Qualify Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related subject area Must have the ability to use time wisely thereby leading to more effective work. What Sets You Apart Understand front-end and back-end of line reliability mechanisms and their impact on long-term product reliability. Having an innovative approach that is open to improving upon any process or product. What We Offer At Micron Total control of how you wish to shape your career path and education. Micron is looking for a Gas System Engineer to join our team. In this role, you will lead the design and optimization of bulk gas distribution systems at the Boise, Idaho campus. You will be performing your job in collaboration with other talented subject matter experts to achieve team success as a facilities organization. As a Design Engineer, You Will Be Responsible For Design in the Non-Volatile Memory Group at Micron Technology, Inc., will be core technical individual contributor in design and validation of the analog and mixed signal subsystem in NAND FLASH chips. In this highly visible and challenging role, you are responsible for analog IP development and product definition, system integration and full-chip and block-level validation plan and execution, including DC-DC switched capacitor converter designs, linear low voltage (LDOs) and high voltage regulators, bandgap voltage generators and DACs, various types of oscillators. You will be designing, simulating, optimizing, and floor planning NAND circuits, evaluating design feasibility, working closely with other functional teams to evaluate, analyze, and improve NAND power consumption. Minimum Qualifications A high level of self-motivation. Prior analog/mixed signal circuit design experience (charge pumps, op amps, DACs, ADCs, linear regulators, oscillators, bandgaps) Proficiency performing analog and mixed signal simulations using standard industry simulators (Verilog, VerilogA, Spice, XA, HSIM) Knowledge of circuit verification and optimization, including layout planning, verification and parasitic extractions of the circuits. Familiarity with Cadence design, LVS/DRC tools (a plus). Good fundamentals in semiconductor and device physics. Strong circuit debugging and problem-solving skills. Good communication and teamwork skills. Knowledge of TCL, PERL or Python is a plus Education/Experience Requirements You are actively pursuing MS degree in Electrical Engineering, or pursuing BS and have 5 years experience. Having design experience of 1- 3 years is desirable. As a Design Verification Engineer Intern for Micron, you will work with a highly innovative and motivated design and verification team using state of the art memory technologies to develop the most advanced DRAM and Emerging memory products. You will be challenged by the complexity and difficulty of verifying high density memory chips (up to 32Gb) with huge scale of circuit capability (over 4M transistors), ultra-high speed designs, complex functionality which includes next Generation DDR/LPDDR (ex: DDR5, LPDDR5) and advanced low power and power management technologies. You will be responsible to evaluate the functionality and performance of the Full-chip and block-level circuit designs using different verification tools, techniques, and strategies. In addition, you will also need to provide solutions to help deliver a functionally correct design. Lastly, you will need to collaborate closely with Micron's various design, verification, and product engineering teams all over the world to ensure design project success. Your Key Responsibilities Will Include Provide verification support to the DRAM and Emerging Memory Design Engineering teams by simulating, analyzing, and debugging pre-silicon full-chip and block-level designs. Assist product engineering teams with circuit and simulation support during post-silicon validation phase. Develop, run, and maintain verification test benches and vectors using industry standard and inhouse developed programs. Write test patterns/vectors and monitors to enhance the functional coverage for all DRAM and Emerging Memory architectures and features. Automate the collection of simulation data through writing software scripts to improve efficiency. Maintain and enhance inhouse developed verification programs and tools. Collaborate closely with international colleagues to develop new verification methodologies and strategies to take on the future challenges in DRAM and Emerging Memory design. As An Intern, Your Responsibility Includes, But Is Not Limited To Welcome to Micron’s Advanced Mask Development Group. Build automated scripts and/or program to improve the efficiency of the current methodology. Identify potential opportunities of improvement, including areas which can be challenging to achieve during the internship period. This position is for an internship in the Metrology Technology Development group in Boise, a growing city that is continuously listed as one of the top in the country. In Metrology, we work on projects meaningful to current and future semiconductor manufacturing needs. Our mission is to develop timely and innovative solutions to the tough challenges our process teams face as technology continues to scale to smaller devices and higher capacities. You will collaborate with engineers in Metrology, in Boise and across the globe, as well as other process areas. Projects may include focus on one or more of disciplines within the metrology group; FIB, Optical Thin Films, Scatterometry/OCD, X-Ray, Overlay/Registration, or CDSEM. Responsibilities Will Include, But Are Not Limited To Complete two or three Metrology related projects, summarize the results, and present your project to the larger Metrology team. Work on new metrology technology and measurement techniques to ensure that our measurement capabilities meet the technical device roadmaps. Working closely with process development and process integration engineers to optimize measurements for multiple device process flows and layer stacks. Developing applications on next generation processes and technologies within Fab 4 and qualification for technology transfers to production fabs. Evaluations of new metrology tools to determine lowest cost of ownership solutions with the highest accuracy and precision for deployment in R&D and high volume manufacturing. Qualifications Passion and deeper understanding of material characterization technologies Background in data science and demonstrated interest in applying it to FIB/SEM/TEM image processing (Computer Vision, ML) and large data analytics Have process and equipment related experience or completed coursework in instrumentation and calibration procedures and semiconductor processing. Possess strong computer skills, including MS Office and JMP, and programming languages such as MATLAB, Python, C, C++. Demonstrate strong data analysis skills and a high level of attention to detail. Have the flexibility to work individually, be part of a team, and lead a team at a per project level. Use strong communication and organizational skills. Education Requirements Applicants should be working towards an M. S. or Ph. D. in Engineering, Physics, Material Science, or a semiconductor-related field. If you are passionate about transmission electron microscopy (TEM) and how to use it to accelerate technology development, our TEM lab is the right place for you. Our lab is located in Boise, Idaho, the place of headquarters for Micron Technology. TEM lab has the most advanced electron microscopes for analytical analysis. Self-motivated, ability to work independently and hardworking in learning new technology and knowledge. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Creative problem-solving skills and details oriented. Job Description As a Cell Film Process Development Engineer at Micron Technology, Inc., you will contribute at a high level as part of process technology team to develop deep sub-micron generation production-worthy and low cost processes. You will provide ownership for both process development & related tool issues for specific films/processes. You will also be responsible for incorporating these processes into corresponding process flow for application in high density advanced memory parts, primarily 3D NAND applications. Responsibilities Include, But Not Limited To You will work with a wide variety of people in multiple disciplines within the R&D process, integration, pilot line, and high-volume production to effectively accomplish tasks in a timely manner Plan and execute effective, well-designed experiments and write clear concise reports documenting the results You will Recognize, suggest process alternatives, and evaluate different options that may provide improved film properties and higher process margins Provide and take constructive criticism from other team members and demonstrate input to drive projects forward You will develop new chemistries and hardware for process innovation You will define process and equipment strategies for next generation NAND Design and execute quality experiments to improve NAND Cell performance Identify and understand failure mechanisms of Cell materials and correlate with NAND Cell electrical behaviors Deliver innovative solutions to enable next generation 3D NAND Cell technology Drive collaboration with integration, device and manufacturing teams to address NAND Cell technology gaps You will initiate and drive project status updates and documentation Minimum Qualifications PhD student in Materials Science and Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Electrical Engineering or similar field. An Understanding Of Deep knowledge of thin film processing (ALD, CVD) and characterization methods Chemical kinetics, thermal dynamics, plasma physics and chemistry, vacuum physics, and their direct application to thin film deposition processes Electronic material properties resulting from various types of deposited thin films. As a Critical Dimension (CD) Applications Process Development Engineer (PDE) Intern, you will be responsible for addressing CD Application issues while working with Photo Process owners, Optical Proximity Team (OPC) Team, Process integration, unit process owners of Dry Etch, Thin Films and vendors for data analysis tools. Advanced CD Application tasks will include data analysis for Global CD i.e., across wafer CD uniformity (CDU), Field CDU i.e., across scanner field CD uniformity, Line width roughness (LWR) i.e., within feature CD non-uniformity with power spectral density (PSD) analysis, characterizing stochastics for Argon Fluoride (ArF) immersion & extreme ultraviolet (EUV) lithography and Edge Placement Error (EPE). In this role, you will actively collaborate with a team of technology partners to develop and integrate CDU solutions to meet device requirements for next-generation semiconductors. Responsibilities Will Include, But Are Not Limited To Work as part of patterning team comprising Photo, Thin-films and Dry etch experts and mitigate CDU errors in Pitch Multiplication processes through improvement of variability of unit processes. Document and communicate plans, status, and results of R&D projects in written reports and presentations, including the analysis and interpretation of data. Qualifications Strong aptitude for research and development and ability to build production worthy technology. Capable of working independently and completing projects in a timely manner. As a Product Quality and Reliability Engineering Intern at Micron, you will support reliability qualification and quality monitoring of DRAM memory products (Compute/Mobile/Graphics DRAM -GDDRx and/or High Bandwidth Memory - HBM), help develop product reliability methodologies, and respond to product deviations as they pertain to quality and reliability. You will have opportunities to gain new product knowledge on an ongoing basis. Responsibilities A successful test development engineer must develop a good understanding of test equipment hardware, device knowledge and software systems. Develop, debug and support test programs from new product introduction phase up through high volume manufacturing Write test programs and support scripts in C++, Python Contribute input and feedback to help define next generation 'design for test' capabilities Analyze device and test flow data to make informed test coverage decisions Balance test time objectives while maintaining optimal yield and quality Collaborate with partners in Product Engineering, Fab, Manufacturing, Yield Enhancement, Global Quality, Systems Integration Group, and Equipment Engineering teams to deliver the right test solution Qualifications Developing array core test solutions will require constant learning and continued technical growth. A successful candidate should understand hardware fundamentals and possess programming capability in a major language. Specific knowledge that'll help: Basic R/L/C circuit knowledge Digital systems and logic gate representation Understanding of CMOS transistor operation Intermediate to advanced programming capability [C++ or Python] Basic Unix / Linux environment Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Basic statistics and data analytics Education Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or a related discipline. This means conducting business with integrity, accountability, and professionalism while supporting our global community. As a Process Development Engineering Intern in Micron's R&D/Technology Development group, you will work on world-class, state-of-the-art semiconductor processes available in few locations in the entire world. Our leading-edge technology makes features less than 10nm. You will contribute and learn about process module development for memory devices, in addition to other process and process integration related activities! You will work with Micron engineers, technology partners and vendors to develop unit processes that meet device requirements for next-generation semiconductors, integrate processes as part of our team, and ultimately provide technology that transfers to Micron’s worldwide manufacturing network. Our process development teams work in the fields of Optical lithography, Plasma Etching, Wet Chemical Processing, Thin Film and Metal depositions, and Chemical-Mechanical Planarization. As part of this team, Micron is looking for engineers with skills in Data Science. Our modern semiconductor fab can produce billions of bits of data. With individually addressable yield data, Optical Emission Spectra, MEMS Microbalance weight data, In-line RGA, On-board Scatterometry, On-Board Imaging, and many others IoT sources, the possibilities to integrate Engineering + Data Science are endless. This position is being offered in Boise, ID. Responsibilities And Duties Work with engineering teams to develop new processes to meet Moore’s Law of Scaling cadence, meet structural and device requirements, and solve integrated yield problems Document and communicate plans, status, and results of R&D projects in written reports and presentations, including the analysis and interpretation of data, and recommendations for future work. Work collaboratively with other Micron engineers and equipment vendors to improve and test new equipment, new chemicals, new process analysis software, and drive process improvements Work in a fast-paced, highly engaging environment with R&D and HVM (high volume manufacturing) partners in globally diverse geographic locations Work hard, play hard, have fun! Qualifications And Skills Include, But Not Limited To Degree/Major: M.S. or Ph.D. in EE, ChE, MSE, ME, Chemistry, Physics, or relevant study Experience with, and understanding of surface analysis techniques like XPS, AFM, XRD, AES, EBSD, SIMS etc. In depth knowledge of the fundamentals of chemical reaction engineering, thermodynamics, heat and mass transfer, plasma science, stress-strain engineering, materials systems. The Signal Integrity Research and Development (SI R&D) team supports all of Micron’s current and future product development. Major product technologies include DRAM, Low-Power DRAM, Reduced Latency DRAM, NAND, NOR, and Solid State Drives within the consumer, server, wireless, and embedded product groups. A major focus for the SI R&D team is integrated circuit package modeling and analysis. The team owns all steps of the signal and power integrity support process including die and package model generation, product electrical signaling performance analysis, system-level SI evaluation, measurement, correlation, and customer support. The team also supports future specification development within several industry standards groups including JEDEC, ONFI, and IBIS. The group’s working environment is diverse, challenging, and team oriented. As a Signal Integrity engineer intern you will be exposed to different product modeling and analysis methods, primarily responsible for learning how to create integrated circuit package models using 3D EM simulation tools for system simulations and analysis. You may also work with various time and frequency domain simulators. You will support and learn from lead and principle Signal Integrity engineers while interacting with package design, silicon design, product engineering, and marketing departments. Description As a Thin Film Intern Process Development Engineer, you will contribute at a level as part of Diffusion/Anneals/Metals/Implant technology team to develop production-worthy, low cost processes, including furnace/CVD/ALD, PVD, beamline implantation, and Plasma Immersion Implantation. You will provide ownership for process development issue for specific films/processes. You will also be responsible in assisting incorporation of these processes into corresponding process flow for application in advanced CMOS, high density 3D NAND, and advanced memory parts. We highly value our interns and make the experience memorable. At the end of your term, you will provide a detailed presentation of your work to the other members of the group. We look forward to hearing from you. This internship position is available starting May 2023 for a duration of 3-4 months. Qualifications Successful candidates for this position will have the following skills and experience: Completed Courses and Lab work in fundamentals of electrical, physical, chemical and mechanical material properties, preferably in growth and characterization of electronic materials and thin films. Understanding of thermal dynamics, chemical kinetics and their direct application to furnace/CVD/ALD, PVD, and ALD deposition processes. Understanding of fundamental plasma processing and its impact on film properties. Ability to apply the fundamental learning, basic principles, theories, and concepts in problem solving with supervisor guidance. Ability to work positively with a wide variety of people in different areas of R&D process to effectively accomplish tasks in a timely manner. Ability to plan and execute effective, well-designed experiments and write clear, concise reports documenting the results. Understanding of the interactions between process and hardware and be able to leverage this knowledge. Identify and evaluate interactions between equipment, modules and processes and resolve related issues. Provide suggested solutions to equipment or process problems. Solve straightforward problems with guidance, as needed, to identify such things as root cause of equipment and/or parameter shifts. Ability to give and take constructive criticism from other team members and be able to leverage input to drive projects forward. Experience and knowledge of Fab metrology tools are plus, such as optical/electrical methods (Rs, thickness, reflectivity, optical constants, stress, and micro-mass measurement, etc.). Understanding of various types of physical film analysis techniques such as SIMS, XPS, EDS, SEM, TEM/EELS, RBS, ICP-GDMS, SRP, XRR, and XRD. Understanding of various thin film electrical evaluation methods and techniques are plus. Ability to evaluate and make insightful inferences from large amounts of various types of data, such as physical & electrical analysis. Demonstrate sound data analysis and judgment. Present reports and findings with appropriate conclusions and recommendations. Ability to interact and collaborate with device integration engineers to develop robust film and related module. In addition, candidates for this position should be highly motivated, goal oriented and possess the ability to aggressively focus on solving problems both as part of a team and individually. Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required to be effective. Must be able to manage projects effectively making best use of available resources. Must be dependable and willing to take responsibility for the development of a process and tool. Must be able to learn new skills as needed. Education Ph.D. candidates, B.S. and M.S. candidates who are intended to pursuit Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering, Materials Science, Physics, Chemistry, Electrical Engineering or similar field. As a Global Facilities Technology Team (GFTT) Chemical and Slurry Systems Engineer at Micron Technology, Inc., you will be responsible to provide high quality engineering services and specifications for the planning, design, construction, operation, and maintenance of your discipline specific facilities systems in support of semiconductor manufacturing across the Micron Global Manufacturing Network. Responsibilities And Tasks Design and Plan Systems and Buildings: Provide system designs for safe operations and maintenance Develop, review, and maintain the equipment and component specifications and standards for the corporation. Review and advise sites on periodic system status presentations (system capacity, actual load, and projected loads based on all approved scenarios, key system accomplishments, and challenges/issues) Assist sites with the evaluate system and distribution capacity impacts based on scenario changes as requested. Reviewing and advising on scope for facilities infrastructure additions or modifications Provide Project Support Provide Micron specifications and standards to Design Firms and reviewing detailed designs and specifications for the installation of new facilities infrastructure Provide support for cost and schedule estimates and justification for approval Provide supervision and coordination of consultant resources required Ensure appropriate communication with local facilities, Design, Construction, Procurement and manufacturing partners as the need arises to deliver project objectives and results. Be responsible for the timely review of design packages and providing detailed comments and feedback. Ensure change management procedures are followed Monitor progress and provide engineering and design support during construction. Provide Technical Support, Leadership, and Expertise Provide consultation and support to Operations and Maintenance and Manufacturing as Technical Discipline Domain Expert Analyze system designs to identify improvements that will result in better performance, efficiency gains, reduced maintenance, and cost savings Support sites with problem analysis using standard tools and methodologies as requested. Provide technical leadership to Procurement group on vendor qualifications, vendor selection and negotiations as needed Conduct risk and failure mode and effects analysis Eliminate single points of failure and mitigate risk Own and maintain of Corporate Best Known Methods (BKM) and Standards for your subject area. Minimum 10-year experience in Semiconductor Process Chemical and Slurry Systems Ability to prioritize and schedule workload and work on multiple tasks concurrently Good organizational skills and service focus. Excellent interpersonal skills and good team working skills, English Required Self-motivated worker Familiarity with semiconductor manufacturing and facilities systems Ability to travel internationally up to 75% of the time At Micron we take pride in empowering our employees and their families to stay happy, healthy, and financially well. Job Title: Memory Architecture Modeling Intern Academic Discipline(s): Electrical, Computer, or Electronics Engineering As a Memory Architecture Modeling Intern in the Advanced System Architecture Group at Micron Technology, Inc., you will work with the memory industry's leading architecture team on new concepts that will shape the future of electronic systems. Your Responsibilities Will Include, But Are Not Limited To Working with system architecture teams to identify key system requirements and current bottlenecks and propose novel solutions to optimize power and performance of next-generation memory and storage subsystems for a wide range of applications. These activities may include configuring, benchmarking, analyzing and tracing applications and their corresponding memory and storage access patterns. The scope of this analysis may span from the low-level software stack (operating system, drivers, etc.) down to the hardware and firmware controllers. Candidates should have strong knowledge of computer architecture and component blocks such as caches, interconnects, memory controllers, etc. The successful applicant will be responsible for workload and architecture modeling, analysis, and correlation of models to their corresponding real systems while working in a collaborative environment. Successful Candidate For This Position Will Have Exposure to server workloads and computing systems with emphasis on their memory & storage subsystems. A strong knowledge through academic coursework of DRAM memory systems. Knowledge of other memory types such as NAND, HBM, GDDR, LPDDR is a plus. Knowledge of DDR memory controller architecture & protocols. ONFI, UFS or NVDIMM is a plus. Must have C/C++ experience. Python and SystemC experience is a plus. Must understand use of the C++ Standard Template Library (STL). Must have Linux experience. Exposure operating system memory management and performance measurement or profiling tools is a plus. Exposure to collaborative software development practices. Exposure to computer architecture analysis and design is a plus. Ability to quickly react and adapt to changes based on modeling results or project changes. Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Must be highly organized and self-motivated. Must be a strong individual contributor as well as a team player. About Micron Technology, Inc. The DRAM and Emerging Memory Engineering Group (DEG) is responsible for developing innovative, high-performance DRAM products for customers all over the world. Our team plays a key role in all phases of the product lifecycle, but is most heavily integrated into the design and development, validation and qualification, production, and support of our products, contributing to over 70% of Micron’s revenue. Verification Methodology Engineering The Design Verification team collaborates with various Micron design and verification teams all over the world to establish and align verification flow development, optimization, and implementation. This team works multi-functionally to assure the best quality, reliability, time-to-market, and customer satisfaction of our products. DFT Design The Design DFT (Design for Test) group designs standard DFT related circuits for use in all DRAM designs across our portfolio. These team members work alongside product and test engineers, as well as, other design groups to define DFT specifications. Digital Verification The Centralized Verification Test Bench team focuses on developing efficient System Verilog and UVM based verification platforms to meet the needs of increased product variations and complexity. Through communication and collaboration with other design groups and business units, this team is responsible for getting our products fully simulated with test bench. IP Design This team focuses on critical circuits common to all DRAM-related memory products through the design of various analog and digital circuits, such as LDO, charge pump, custom digital circuits, as well as, power delivery network evaluation and optimization. The IP design team collaborates closely with Product Engineers to verify silicon performance vs. simulation performance of circuits, and with Process Integration teams to design circuits for our next innovative process nodes. Layout The Layout team translates schematic representations of circuits into physical representation of interconnected shapes. These representations are then used to create photo masks used in fabrication of our products. The Layout team is responsible for verifying the quality of layouts using industry and Micron tools to ensure circuit functionality matches schematic expectations. DRAM Design The DRAM Design Engineering team is responsible for the design, layout, and optimization of memory/logic/analog circuits used in our memory products, focusing on DDR4 and DDR5 portfolios. The design team partners closely with Micron’s various design and verification teams all over the world and supports the efforts of groups such as Product Engineering, Test, Probe, Process Integration, Assembly, and Marketing. Responsibilities Will Include, But Are Not Limited To Contributing to the development of new product opportunities by assisting with the overall design, layout, and optimization of Memory/Logic/Analog circuits Parasitic modeling and assisting in design validation, reticle experiments and required tape-out revisions Overseeing and managing the layout process including floor-planning, placement, and routing Performing verification processes with modeling and simulation using industry standard simulators Contributing to cross group communication to work towards standardization and group success Working with Marketing, Probe, Assembly, Test, Process Integration, and Product Engineering groups to ensure accurate manufacturability of product Proactively solicit guidance from Standards, CAD, modeling, and verification groups to improve the design quality Driving innovation into the future Memory generations within a dynamic work environment About Micron Technology, Inc. Do you love the interaction of brand-new hardware and innovative software solutions? Do you like to learn new technology and enjoy solving sophisticated problems? In today's data economy, memory and storage products are essential to advancing brand-new computing technology. Continued scaling of memory technology presents challenges that require sophisticated and creative testing solutions. We are constantly evolving and need your passion and excitement to help take the team to the next level! Test Solutions Engineering - Product Test Engineer As a Product Test Engineer, we are responsible for the development, debug and maintenance of test programs that help deliver Micron's world-class Memory portfolio to market. We write test programs, develop new test methodologies, and analyzing Probe data to expedite Micron's product development’s and cycles of learning. We work closely with Process Integration, Product Engineering, Quality Assurance, and Yield Enhancement teams to ensure accurate test coverage for Micron’s memory products. We help transfer the newly developed technology into production, and responsible to ensure the product meets qualification specification and schedule. We are looking for someone with ability to work independently, excellent communication skills, and the ability to balance multiple tasks while meeting project deadlines. Responsibilities Our responsibilities may include, but are not limited to: Design new test programs for 1st silicon validation of new product/technology Optimize test programs by applying more efficient testing methods to reduce product test times and manufacturing costs. Automate test processes by writing software to improve work efficiency. Develop tools to help provide better analysis and insight of the terabytes of probe data. Develop new Design For Test (DFT) and Design For Manufacturability (DFM) capabilities Work with internal and external suppliers to develop and qualify new test solutions Collaborate with other engineering departments to improve overall product yield and quality. Qualifications Test Solution Engineering is a multi-disciplinary field, requiring knowledge of semiconductor operation, computer architecture, programming, and statistics. We are looking for candidates with strong interest in hardware, software, and problem solving. Successful Candidates For This Position Will Have Basic Electronics/Electrical circuit knowledge as applied in memory devices and test equipment Knowledge of digital systems and logic gates Knowledge of CMOS transistor operation Basic understanding of semiconductor device physics Intermediate to advanced programming and program-debug skills, with C++ being the ideal area of expertise The ability to work independently Excellent technical communication skills The ability to read and understand product datasheets Useful Additional Knowledge Basic Unix/Linux command familiarity Python / Perl familiarity or experience A good understanding of statistics Basic skills in plotting charts and analyze data ATE experience is beneficial Required Education Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or a related field. Our team vision is a continuing desire to develop your skills working with an inclusive diverse environment of multi-cultural teams across worldwide geographies! We have a dedicated Micron University for your online learning. And thanks to our welcoming yet fast-paced work environment, it is easy to collaborate with fellow team members to get difficult problems solved and turn customers’ dreams into reality faster. Responsibilities A successful test engineer must develop a good understanding of test equipment hardware, device knowledge and software systems. Develop, debug and support test programs from new product introduction phase up through high volume manufacturing Write test programs and support scripts in C++, Python Contribute input and feedback to help define next generation 'design for test' capabilities Analyze device and test flow data to make informed test coverage decisions Balance test time objectives while maintaining optimal yield and quality Collaborate with partners in Design and Product Engineering, Fab, Manufacturing, Yield Enhancement, Global Quality, Systems Integration Group, and Equipment Engineering teams to deliver the right test solution Qualifications Developing array core test solutions will require constant learning and continued technical growth. A successful candidate should understand hardware fundamentals and possess programming capability in a major language. Specific knowledge that'll help: Basic R/L/C circuit knowledge Digital systems and logic gate representation Understanding of CMOS transistor operation Intermediate to advanced programming capability [C++ or Python] Basic Unix / Linux environment Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Basic statistics and data analytics Education Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or a related discipline. As a Safety Engineer with our Industrial Health team at Micron Technology, you will focus on the prevention of unplanned events that have the potential to harm people, property, or the environment at a large semiconductor manufacturing location. In addition, you will continuously evaluate operations to ensure compliance with applicable regulations. You will perform technical evaluations of work areas, equipment and operational procedures to identify hazards and ensure proper safety controls remain in place. You will work with a talented group of managers, supervisors, employees, engineers and technicians to continuously improve safety programs that allow Micron to achieve world-class safety performance. Responsibilities for this role include, but are not limited to, the following: Provide oversight of Construction Project and General Contractors to ensure organizations requirements are effectively implemented Coordinate development of training facility and programs to be used by General Contractors to train staff. Support safety programs that transition from construction safety oversight to manufacturing safety program implementation as projects move toward conclusion. Support Safety Management System across construction and industrial environments Review building and system designs for compliance and integration of safety by design best known methods (BKM) Conduct detailed task and process hazard analysis and risk assessments Develop, implement, and continually improve Micron’s safety programs and operating procedures to assure worker safety and property conservation Evaluate operations to confirm compliance with applicable regulatory requirements and benchmark industry standards Monitor changes to regulatory requirements and implement changes as required Develop and conduct safety training Plan, develop, and perform site safety audits in conjunction with area personnel Coordinate regulatory compliance inspections Respond as safety officer to emergencies and rotate through an “on-call” schedule Perform investigations of accidents and unplanned events Collect, evaluate, and communicate safety performance measurements to site management Support continuous improvement of Micron’s Occupation Health and Safety Management System Qualifications Successful candidates for this position will have: 3+ years professional experience in Safety or Industrial Hygiene field preferred. As a Design Engineer at Micron Technology, Inc., you will be responsible for designing and analyzing digital and analog circuits used in the development of memory products. The Micron Commercial Products Group (CPG) is seeking a Sr. Director of Integrated Marketing responsible FOR Brand, Channel & Digital Marketing reporting to the Vice President of the Commercial Products Group. CPG provides leading products in the areas of DRAM and SSD under the Crucial & Micron Brand through a network of etail/retail, distribution companies and system integrators across the world. Develop and execute overall marketing plans, including Brand, Channel and Digital (including SEM, paid social media, search and display advertising campaigns). Accountable for CPG press releases & Media relations. Oversee the spend and budgeting process, including monthly forecasting and reporting on spend and ROI Ensure best in class content aimed at Channel CPG product and work with Sales teams to develop, implement and measure success of channel programs for best ROI for spending & MDF. Partner with the product marketing teams on product positioning, messaging and content and work to continuously test and improve campaign creative, copy, and audience targeting to ensure campaign optimization. Work with analytics, decision science, and business operations to ensure optimal ROI for marketing investment. Develop and maintain key vendor partnerships to shape new opportunities and to keep digital capabilities at best-in-class Analyze cross-channel attribution performance to mine campaign performance insights and drive future campaign testing Ideal Experience The ideal candidate will bring progressive, marketing leadership experience. 10+ years’ experience in digital marketing with a heavy focus on paid search/social/display marketing Strong experience in launching products in Etail/Retail along with knowledge of key global market, customers and supply chains. Deep understanding of Consumer Electronics industry and Channel. Deep quantitative skills. Ability to analyze & develop business/marketing models for acquisition programs. Ability to direct and guide team members to do the same. Work with Analytics teams to provide key analysis. Track record of developing teams with outstanding problem-solving skills. You are not just repeating a playbook, you are looking at every problem with fresh eyes and digging deep for insights and solutions. Ability to coordinate between multiple teams across the organization Key Competencies Drives Results – Result-oriented and acts in the best interests of the company. Smart, articulate, collaborative. Exceptional Marketing Skills – Superior marketing mind, can see big market opportunities yet able to focus on segments that deliver profitable revenue in a timely manner. Collaboration and Influencing Skills – Utilizes interpersonal relations, judgment skills, and data to guide senior management and influence outcomes. Collaborate with Micron’s Corporate Finance and Treasury teams on capital markets transactions and provide legal advice and guidance concerning compliance with credit facilities and debt instruments Partner with General Counsel and CFO on shareholder and investor relations matters, including Regulation FD compliance, earnings call materials, and providing strategic legal advice and guidance to senior management and the Board With support from Micron’s General Counsel, head of Legal Operations, People organization and Finance team, have ownership of and accountability to a budget for Micron’s corporate legal team What We’re Looking For J.D. degree from an accredited law school, along with active membership in at least one state bar 10+ years experience in corporate law, including M&A, capital markets transactions, securities law and/or executive compensation. Serve as the principal legal partner for Micron’s corporate development team and participate in shaping and implementing strategy and activities related to identifying, evaluating, and negotiating strategic collaborations and M&A Partner with other members of Micron’s legal team to support cross-functional projects and support activities designed to improve departmental processes and important strategic initiatives as we strive to be the raddest legal team in the universe! Position Overview Micron is seeking a Senior Director, Global Payroll Leader who is a proven professional with experience leading global payroll teams. The Global Payroll Leader is a critical member of the Finance team and is responsible for providing direction on global payroll for approximately 45,000 employees. The ideal candidate is experienced in global payroll operations and has a passion for creating innovative payroll solutions, with a proven ability to recruit, build and manage a world class organization. This role will develop talent, balance capabilities, costs and service levels and work effectively cross-functionally in a rapidly changing and growing environment. As a key leader, reporting to the Chief Accounting Officer, you will be responsible for defining and executing efficient and effective ongoing payroll operations, support new and existing pay programs (local and global), manage vendor contracts and relationships, and drive process optimization and improvement in the controls for payroll and timekeeping globally. The position will also own the strategy for 3rd party vendors to ensure payroll accuracy and compliance in multiple countries. You will identify and develop leading practice guidance and will drive consistency and efficiencies across the team. Success in this role is dependent on leadership, organization/people development, process improvement, strategic execution, ability to deal with a rapidly changing business environment and communication. Responsibilities Fully own the global payroll operations in our Americas, EMEA and APAC regions. Manages day to day activities for all aspects of the comprehensive payroll operation, including vendor management, to oversee the timely and accurate payroll processing. Ensures payroll services are processed in accordance with established policies and procedures along with all compliance requirements. Leads the payroll team to ensure payroll operations occur on time and accurately. Responsible for corporate payroll strategy, planning and communications. Micron’s Signal Integrity Research and Development (SI R&D) group supports all current and future product development, including DRAM, LPDRAM, NAND, NOR, 3DXP, DIMM modules and SSDs within the consumer, server, mobile, networking, graphics, automobile and embedded businesses. The SI R&D works on analysis of end to end systems solutions including but not limited to circuit level, integrated circuit (IC) packages, printed circuit boards (PCBs) and measurements to ensure good Signal Integrity (SI) and power integrity (PI) performance for Micron’s memory solutions. The team owns all steps of the signal and power integrity support process including die and package model generation, product performance analysis, system-level SI evaluation, measurement, correlation, and customer support. The team also supports future specification development within several industry standards groups including but not limited to JEDEC, ONFI, and IBIS. The group working environment is technically challenging, team-oriented, collaborative and customer-centric.  Within the larger SI R&D group, as a Principal Signal Integrity Engineer at Micron, you will be responsible for Leading the design and analysis of high speed (HS) memory interfaces and power distribution networks (PDN). Leading out in SI/PI development across a broad range of Micron’s portfolio to ensure product electrical performance through modeling, simulation, analysis, and correlation to measurement for the various products. Representing the SI R&D team in technical cross functional collaborative groups, and integrating with package design, silicon design, product engineering, and marketing departments to ensure overall product performance. Driving and development of SI/PI aspects of future standards (including but not limited to JEDEC, ONFI, and IBIS) through system and product electrical capability exploration. Supporting external customer as needed Developing methodologies and processes for SI/PI analysis Supporting (and in some cases driving) path-finding activities for IO and channel innovation to enable next generation of memory technologies at higher speeds and densities Qualifications Successful candidates for this position will have:  PhD or MSEE w/15 years of industry experience Strong SI/PI/EMI theory and application, modeling, analysis, simulation Signal and Power Integrity Background, particularly in areas that affect I/O circuit and signaling performance. Required courses covering electromagnetic, transmission line and RF theory, analog design or similar fields of study or experience. Experience with, and intermediate working knowledge of E.M. field solvers (quasi-static and full wave), time and frequency domain simulation tools like Q3D, SIWAVE, HFSS, HSPICE, ADS, etc.. Deep understanding of electromagnetic and transmission line theory, general I/O design, signal integrity, differential and single-ended interface technologies. Deep understanding of timing budgets and jitter analysis Expertise in Printed Circuit Board (PCB) layout or electrical package design techniques. Experience in design and analysis of high-speed single-ended or differential buses Familiarity with, and fundamental understanding of lab measurement equipment like Oscilloscopes, TDR, Vector Network Analyzer (VNA), etc. Familiarity with statistical analysis (DOE) and equivalent tools (example: JMP) is also beneficial Desirable Mixed-signal Circuit Design Background Desirable Memory industry experience Ambitious candidate should enjoy leading and taking ownership of assigned projects, exhibit good written and verbal interpersonal skills, and have the ability to work well in a team with varied strengths. Position Description Micron Technology’s goal is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all. Our dedication to people, innovation, resourcefulness, collaboration, and customer enablement allows us to fulfill our mission to be a global technology leader. Do you want to work in a results-oriented multi-discipline design engineering environment, writing, and debugging software on physical hardware? Does innovating, contributing to electrical designs, optimizing, and debugging next-generation semiconductor test equipment for one of the world’s largest semiconductor manufacturers appeal to you? Our embedded software team is looking to hire a driven, motivated software engineer who will build both embedded software running on bare metal and RTOSes as well as higher level interface software. You will work with other software engineers and other engineering disciplines to create semiconductor testers from the ground up. Daily Work Our embedded team engages with software, electrical, control, and mechanical engineering design teams. We develop embedded and interface software, analyze schematics, review PCB layouts, prototype circuits, debug hardware, automate testing, develop user libraries to control hardware, and create documentation. We write code primarily in C, C++, and Python in the Linux environment for various microcontrollers and computing modules acting as the interface to custom hardware. You will have the opportunity to work with senior and principal engineers and be teamed with an experienced embedded engineering mentor, to help teach, guide, and advance your engineering career. Hiring Group Engineering members of our team, the Micron Systems Integration Group (SIG), are a group who enjoy being challenged with a wide range of software and hardware engineering projects. We enjoy challenges, growth opportunities, always striving to improve. Our group is tasked with enabling strategic cost, capability, and time to market advantage to Micron Technology Inc. Our work is essential to keep Micron at the forefront of the global memory market. We are continuously challenged to develop innovative production test solutions that are customized to Micron's needs. We must be more agile, robust, efficient, and capable than our competitors. Enabling the creative career path you deserve with competitive compensation, bonus structure & equity. Micron is THE place for you to expand your caliber by working on key projects, developing the leader in you! We provide online learning opportunities and on-the-job training to upgrade your skills. We have a dedicated Micron University for your online learning. Our focus is empowering our customers’ latest and the greatest innovations across a wide spectrum of industries and applications—so your work as a Micron team member can have a broad impact. And thanks to our welcoming yet fast-paced work environment, it is easy to collaborate with fellow team members to get difficult problems solved and turn customers’ dreams into reality faster. Micron’s Signal Integrity Research and Development (SI R&D) group supports all current and future product development, including DRAM, LPDRAM, NAND, NOR, 3DXP, DIMM modules and SSDs within the consumer, server, mobile, networking, graphics, automobile and embedded businesses. The SI R&D works on analysis of end to end systems solutions including but not limited to circuit level, integrated circuit (IC) packages, printed circuit boards (PCBs) and measurements to ensure good Signal Integrity (SI) and power integrity (PI) performance for Micron’s memory solutions. The team owns all steps of the signal and power integrity support process including die and package model generation, product performance analysis, system-level SI evaluation, measurement, correlation, and customer support. The team also supports future specification development within several industry standards groups including but not limited to JEDEC, ONFI, and IBIS. The group working environment is technically challenging, team-oriented, collaborative and customer-centric.  Within the larger SI R&D group, as a Principal Signal Integrity Engineer at Micron, you will be responsible for Leading the design and analysis of high speed (HS) memory interfaces and power distribution networks (PDN). Leading out in SI/PI development across a broad range of Micron’s portfolio to ensure product electrical performance through modeling, simulation, analysis, and correlation to measurement for the various products. Representing the SI R&D team in technical cross functional collaborative groups, and integrating with package design, silicon design, product engineering, and marketing departments to ensure overall product performance. Driving and development of SI/PI aspects of future standards (including but not limited to JEDEC, ONFI, and IBIS) through system and product electrical capability exploration. Supporting external customer as needed Developing methodologies and processes for SI/PI analysis Supporting (and in some cases driving) path-finding activities for IO and channel innovation to enable next generation of memory technologies at higher speeds and densities Qualifications Successful candidates for this position will have:  PhD or MSEE w/15 years of industry experience Strong SI/PI/EMI theory and application, modeling, analysis, simulation Signal and Power Integrity Background, particularly in areas that affect I/O circuit and signaling performance. Required courses covering electromagnetic, transmission line and RF theory, analog design or similar fields of study or experience. Experience with, and intermediate working knowledge of E.M. field solvers (quasi-static and full wave), time and frequency domain simulation tools like Q3D, SIWAVE, HFSS, HSPICE, ADS, etc.. Deep understanding of electromagnetic and transmission line theory, general I/O design, signal integrity, differential and single-ended interface technologies. Deep understanding of timing budgets and jitter analysis Expertise in Printed Circuit Board (PCB) layout or electrical package design techniques. Experience in design and analysis of high-speed single-ended or differential buses Familiarity with, and fundamental understanding of lab measurement equipment like Oscilloscopes, TDR, Vector Network Analyzer (VNA), etc. Familiarity with statistical analysis (DOE) and equivalent tools (example: JMP) is also beneficial Desirable Mixed-signal Circuit Design Background Desirable Memory industry experience Ambitious candidate should enjoy leading and taking ownership of assigned projects, exhibit good written and verbal interpersonal skills, and have the ability to work well in a team with varied strengths.
