Signal Integrity Engineer -NCG Description The Signal Integrity Research and Development (SI R&D) team supports all of Micron’s current and future product developments. Major product technologies developed at Micron include DRAM, LPDRAM, Graphics DRAM, NAND, HBM, HMC, Managed NAND and SSDs within the consumer, server, mobile, networking, graphics, automobile and embedded businesses. The team owns all steps of the SI/PI analysis and optimization for SSDs and memory modules in a system environment. The team also supports future specification development within several industry standards groups including JEDEC and ONFI. The group working environment is diverse, challenging, and team oriented. As an Signal Integrity Engineer at Micron Technology, Inc., you would be responsible for analyzing and optimizing solid state drives (SSDs) and memory modules. You would be performing SI/PI analysis on high speed interfaces such as PCIe, SATA, SAS, DDR4/5, ONFI 3.0/4.0, LPDDR4/5. You will work with SSDs and memory modules to provide optimum routing solutions with good electical performance that meet System Integration requirements. You will be integrating with package design, silicon design, product engineering, and marketing departments to ensure overall product performance. You will also be involved on future standards development efforts through system and product electrical capability exploration. Additional involvement will include external customer support and group methodology development. Qualifications Successful candidates for this position will have: MSEE or PhD degree. Required courses covering electromagnetic, transmission line and RF theory, analog design or similar fields of study or experience. Working knowledge of 3D E.M. field solvers, time and frequency domain simulation tools like HFSS, HSPICE, ADS, etc.. Working knowledge of PCB board level simulation tools like Cadence Allegro Sigrity etc. Understanding of electromagnetic and transmission line theory, general I/O design, signal integrity, differential and single ended interface technologies. Knowledgeable of Printed Circuit Board (PCB) layout or electrical package design techniques. Familiarity with high speed interfaces such as PCIe, SATA, SAS, DDR4/5, LPDDR4/5 and ONFI standards. Familiarity with HVM corner cases and statistical analysis and equivalent tools (example: JMP) is also beneficial Familiarity and fundamental understanding of lab measurement equipment Oscilloscopes, TDR, Vector Network Analyzer (VNA), etc. Self-motivated - candidate and exhibit good written and verbal communication skills, and have the ability to work well in a diverse team environment. Sustaining Engineer, Electrical – Engineering Change Management Micron Technology’s vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life and our commitment to people, innovation, tenacity, collaboration, and customer focus allows us to fulfill our mission to be a global leader in memory and storage solutions. This means conducting business with integrity, accountability, and professionalism while supporting our global community. If this sounds like place you would like to work, we want you! At Systems integration Group (SIG), we define, design, and build sophisticated test equipment to support Micron manufacturing. Within the SIG Engineering Change Management (ECM) team, we manage changes to test equipment and supporting equipment transparently, to established processes, and with an emphasis to reduce risk to our partners, SIG, and Micron. As a Sustaining Engineer, Electrical, you will work closely with multidisciplinary design teams to reduce the impact of change at the partner, test system, and development resource level and prioritize change activities so impact to manufacturing is minimized and energy is focused where the return is greatest. Responsibilities Include, But Not Limited To Understanding the reason for the change Using appropriate methods to identify alternate components The ability to perform an impact analysis that includes: A detailed description of differences between candidate and qualified component Where the impacted component is used Analysis of the circuits where impacted component is used Potential electrical simulation to understand performance of the circuit with an alternative component Verification plans Validation plans An implementation timeline Other relevant data associated to making a change Championing engineering change process Educating team members on appropriate methods for implementing change Creating/updating change related processes and procedures Responding to and creating appropriate metrics as part of understanding how successful change happens. Continuous improvement suggestions Recognizing opportunities to reduce risk or “shift left” Minimum Qualifications Ability to analyze electrical components Ability to analyze alternate component sources Knowledge of component qualification process Ability to problem solve production and test issues as part of evaluation of change Ability to evaluate and update schematics Knowledge of engineering document control Ability to collaborate with Development Engineering, Operations, and Contract Manufacturing Ability to compose Product Change Evaluation (PCE) Reports Knowledge of Statistical Analysis of Production Data Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or related field Development in analytical thinking, problem solving, personal initiative, interpersonal skills, and a growth mindset will be expected in this role. Job Description As a TSE (Test Solutions Engineering) System Administrator at Micron Technology, Inc., you will ensure consistent and reliable installation and management of the Unix/Linux servers, VMs and cloud environments. Job Description Do you love the interaction of brand-new hardware and innovative software solutions? Do you like to learn new technology and enjoy solving sophisticated problems? In today's data economy, memory and storage products are essential to advancing brand-new computing technology. Continued scaling of memory technology presents challenges that require sophisticated and creative testing solutions. We are constantly evolving and need your passion and excitement to help take the team to the next level! Test Solutions Engineering - Product Test Engineer As a Product Test Engineer, we are responsible for the development, debug and maintenance of test programs that help deliver Micron's world-class Memory portfolio to market. We write test programs, develop new test methodologies, and analyzing Probe data to expedite Micron's product development’s and cycles of learning. We work closely with Process Integration, Product Engineering, Quality Assurance, and Yield Enhancement teams to ensure accurate test coverage for Micron’s memory products. We help transfer the newly developed technology into production, and responsible to ensure the product meets qualification specification and schedule. We are looking for someone with ability to work independently, excellent communication skills, and the ability to balance multiple tasks while meeting project deadlines. Responsibilities Our responsibilities may include, but are not limited to: Design new test programs for 1st silicon validation of new product/technology Optimize test programs by applying more efficient testing methods to reduce product test times and manufacturing costs. Automate test processes by writing software to improve work efficiency. Develop tools to help provide better analysis and insight of the terabytes of probe data. Develop new Design For Test (DFT) and Design For Manufacturability (DFM) capabilities Work with internal and external suppliers to develop and qualify new test solutions Collaborate with other engineering departments to improve overall product yield and quality. Qualifications Test Solution Engineering is a multi-disciplinary field, requiring knowledge of semiconductor operation, computer architecture, programming, and statistics. We are looking for candidates with strong interest in hardware, software, and problem solving. Successful Candidates For This Position Will Have Basic Electronics/Electrical circuit knowledge as applied in memory devices and test equipment Knowledge of digital systems and logic gates Knowledge of CMOS transistor operation Basic understanding of semiconductor device physics Intermediate to advanced programming and program-debug skills, with C++ being the ideal area of expertise The ability to work independently Excellent technical communication skills The ability to read and understand product datasheets Useful Additional Knowledge Basic Unix/Linux command familiarity Python / Perl familiarity or experience A good understanding of statistics Basic skills in plotting charts and analyze data ATE experience is beneficial Required Education Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or a related field. This position will report directly to the Corporate Vice President of Public Affairs, and will be based in Washington, DC. Responsibilities And Duties Design and execute the strategies and tactics for achieving goals with relevant Congressional, Administrative and Agency organizations and persons by employing an innovative and effective team and set of external resources. Assist in leading, measuring and guiding external consulting resources to bring focus on issues or relationship development within the regulatory and legislative arenas or other areas of support as designated. Build an environment that both educates and deeply involves all other appropriate Micron leaders on legislative policy issues working closely with the Head of Policy & Research. This work will involve establishing meaningful structure, processes and information flow. Build, manage, oversee and run an internal Advisory Council for US Government Affairs, PAC Board, integrated with a Global Government Affairs Advisory Council. Ensure measurable and effective outcomes of the advocacy strategy through brand building, relationship management and strategic engagement and deployment of internal and external resources. Critical to this endeavor is development of appropriate actionable relationships with key Administration individuals, Capitol Hill and selected areas of the Executive Branch. Efficiently and appropriately build a plan to use executive leadership as political assets, advocates, and brand ambassadors, and lead them toward the attainment of legislative, policy and regulatory goals. Support the management and growth, governance and policies around Micron’s existing Political Action Committee, in partnership with the Head of State & Local Government Affairs, focusing especially on those geographic areas where Micron has a corporate footprint or the legislative districts of key influencers. Develop political engagement strategies beyond PAC for opportunities to engage with appropriate covered officials. Ensure compliance, internal education and understanding of the development. Continue to expand Micron’s brand in the policy and political community to include all appropriate outreach programs, civic event sponsorships, political fundraising events, third party groups, partnerships and development. Qualifications And Skills The ability to bring strong credibility to Micron’s brand and industry leadership in the policy ecosystem. A detailed understanding of the U.S. government including the interaction with the global landscape and trade policy, national security issues, manufacturing and technology stakeholders. If coming from another corporation or association, successful prior experience integrating the legislative policy developed by the federal government affairs team across a global company. Given the complexity of geopolitical, political and policy areas facing global companies and the semiconductor industry, the candidate must be able to work with diverse business lines and functional partners. Highly developed ability to comprehend, and predict, critical issues and trends, distill them to their important aspects, formulate an appropriate response and communicate strategies to all levels within Micron senior management team and within appropriate government constituencies. Knowledge of, and relations with, key U.S. stakeholders, Dept of State, Dept of Commerce, NSC, NEC are all positive attributes. Experience in the legislative environment at the Legislative or Executive Branch or agency level. Ability to persuasively communicate at the highest levels of government is essential. Undergraduate degree is required. An advanced degree or a Juris Doctor is preferred. Job Summary And Description As a Shift Equipment Engineer at Micron Technology in Boise, Idaho, you are responsible for supervising, sustaining, and improving the equipment and/or processes, while working in partnership with production team members and area engineers. In this position you will supervise tool performance, schedule and perform preventative maintenance on assigned tool sets, and use mechanical, electronic and PC/software skills to solve and repair equipment issues. They are also required to assist with equipment installs, engineering tests, build and modify equipment procedures, increase tool uptime through systematic problem solving and troubleshooting, quality workmanship, and thoroughly document all maintenance. Safety & Quality Safety and quality are primary characteristics of the work being performed. This includes completing the required safety training and conducting all work in accordance with safety policies and laws. A safe and high quality demeanor means following up and looking out for related issues immediately and works towards resolution with partners. We all perform and facilitate audits and submits good catches on safety issues to proactively reduces incidents of personal injuries, safety hazards or environmental impact. We operate and maintains tools according to documentation and guidelines to ensure safety and quality expectations are met. Communication & Collaboration In order to work efficiently at a world class level we need to collaborate with all areas and work functions. This includes Partners with 1st Shift Engineers and Shift Engineers/Technicians to execute to daily activities and extraordinary activities that include issues that could cause yield loss, excursions, defects, tool restrictions, or output loss. We collaborate with leaders on our improvement opportunities to construct personal performance and development goals. This benefits everyone by improving performance, output and job satisfaction. Clear written communication is meaningful to ensures pass down communications are updated and accurately reflects the work performed and tool current statuses. This increases our work efficiency and quality tracking. Technical/Data Analysis You will have opportunities to solve equipment and process issues to enable manufacturing development. As you grow in the role you will be able to provide mentorship to your peers as you resolve highly technical equipment issues and drive to root cause and permanent prevention. As you work within a Total Productive Maintenance culture the practices will include improving overall equipment effectiveness. This will result with partnering with teammates to eliminate defects create continuous improvement projects. Analyzing data with SPC principles such as improving process control and reducing defectivity baselines and how the equipment affects SPC performance will enable more effective equipment. Project Management/Planning Improving what we do and how we work is part of everyday activities Micron! You are responsible for collaborating with equipment owners to develop, prioritize, and run projects. Often will be leading projects to ensure objectives are completed within the required scope, schedule and budget. Tracking actions and providing solution paths or resources to ensure actions will be completed on time will be required to be successful at project management. Successful Candidates Must Have The Following Qualifications Successful equipment engineers are proficient in electricity, vacuum, gas flow and mechanical fundamentals. They are able to utilize schematic diagrams to fix systems to components level. Software skills enable a higher level of efficiency and improvements. Having competent skills in Python, Java, Tableau, Matlab, MS Office Suite, Jmp, Solidworks, and Autocad will make a strong and successful candidate. As you become experienced you will know the process flow related to area equipment. This includes knowing how the process recipes work and what the equipment is being expected to do during the recipe. Have intermediate understanding of the Fab process areas and including area processing equipment and supporting systems. There will be an abundance of opportunities for improvement that will require having solid time management, organization, and prioritization skills. This position will require some flexibility with job responsibilities and shift assignments. About Micron Technology, Inc.
